intro: Ceratosanthes hassleri, commonly known as the yellow sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family, characterized by its showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. It has slender, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Ceratosanthes hassleri is known for its ecological importance as a nectar source for various pollinators, including bees and butterflies.
